cards.name: Panic
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Play Panic only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature can't block this turn. 
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Pyrokinesis
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
cards.flavor:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: The number of targets must be at least one and at most four. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn't resolve.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.originalText:
You may remove a red card in your hand from the game rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Retribution
cards.text: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.

rulings.text: The player chooses which one to sacrifice as Retribution resolves. If only one of the targets is still legal at that time, then the player must choose that one to sacrifice.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.

cards.name: Rogue Skycaptain
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay {2} for each wage counter on it. If you don't, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.

rulings.text: No choices are made when this ability triggers. After the wage counter is put on Rogue Skycaptain, then you choose whether to pay mana and, if you don't, which opponent gains control of it.
If you can't pay the entire payment, none of it is paid.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay {2} for each wage counter on it. If you don't, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

cards.originalText: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Stonehands
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Varchild's Crusader
cards.text: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"Every patch of land must belong to Kjeldor, no matter what the cost!"
—General Varchild
cards.originalText: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at end of turn.

cards.name: Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: One aurochs may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

rulings.text: The bonus is not applied until after you check for attack legality, so it is a 2/3 creature when declaring attackers.
The ability counts the number of attacking creatures with the creature type Aurochs, not just those named Aurochs.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.

cards.name: Bounty of the Hunt
cards.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
cards.originalText:
You may remove a green card in your hand from the game rather than pay Bounty of the Hunt's mana cost.
Until end of turn, target creature gets +1/+1, target creature gets +1/+1, and target creature gets +1/+1.

cards.name: Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.

rulings.text: This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Elvish Farmer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Elvish Farmer.
Remove three spore counters from Elvish Farmer: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Elvish Farmer.
Remove three spore counters from Elvish Farmer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.
Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Elvish Hunter
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"As the climate cooled, many elves turned to thallid farming for food, while the hunters honed their skills on what little game remained."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

rulings.text: You may target any creature with this ability. It doesn't have to be tapped.
If the targeted creature is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when the targeted creature is tapped.

Elvish Hunter doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Elvish Hunter will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Elvish Ranger
cards.flavor:
"How can any human hope to match our skills? We are children of Fyndhorn, and its sap runs in our veins."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Elvish Spirit Guide
cards.text: Exile Elvish Spirit Guide from your hand: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
"We are never without guidance, if we but seek it."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

rulings.text: This ability is a mana ability.

cards.originalText: Remove Elvish Spirit Guide in your hand from the game: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Essence Filter
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments or all nonwhite enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"Freyalise has cleansed our bodies and minds of the plagues of Kjeldor; all she asks in return is that we keep pure our newly given home in Fyndhorn."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments or all nonwhite enchantments.

cards.name: Feral Thallid
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Feral Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Feral Thallid: Regenerate Feral Thallid.
cards.flavor:
"Born and bred of fungus, thallids were nearly impossible to kill."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Feral Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Feral Thallid: Regenerate Feral Thallid.

cards.name: Folk of the Pines
cards.text: {1}{G}: Folk of the Pines gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our friends of the forest take many forms, yet all serve the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Folk of the Pines gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Forbidden Lore
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn."

rulings.text: Forbidden Lore grants an activated ability to the enchanted land. Only that land's controller can activate the ability.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Forgotten Lore
cards.text: Target opponent chooses a card in your graveyard. You may pay {G}. If you do, repeat this process except that opponent can't choose a card already chosen for Forgotten Lore. Then put the last chosen card into your hand.
cards.flavor: In ashes are the gems of history.

rulings.text: You target an opponent when you cast Forgotten Lore. The opponent chooses a card in your graveyard as Forgotten Lore resolves. After that choice is made, you're given the option to pay {G}. If you do, the targeted opponent must choose a different card, if there is one. (If there isn't one, this part is skipped.) Then you're given the option to pay {G} again. As long as you keep paying {G}, the process continues. As soon as you decline to pay {G}, the last card that was chosen by the opponent is put into your hand.
The spell has no knowledge of cards chosen for other spells named Forgotten Lore.

cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses a card in your graveyard. You may pay {G}. If you do, repeat this process except that opponent can't choose a card already chosen for Forgotten Lore. Then put the last chosen card into your hand.

cards.name: Fungal Bloom
cards.text: {G}{G}: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.
cards.flavor:
"Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Pollen
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
All creatures get -1/-0.
{1}{G}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I breathed deeply, and suddenly I knew not who or where I was."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, the goddess Freyalise is generous to her children."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Johtull Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
cards.flavor:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.originalText: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.

cards.name: Joven's Ferrets
cards.text:
Whenever Joven's Ferrets attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
At end of combat, tap all creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets this turn. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: The second ability will trigger only if Joven's Ferrets is still on the battlefield at end of combat. If it's been dealt lethal combat damage and destroyed during that combat (or has left the battlefield during that combat by any other means), its ability won't trigger and the creatures that blocked it won't be affected.

If a creature affected by the second ability is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

The second ability doesn't track the creatures' controllers. If an affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Joven's Ferrets will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText:
Whenever Joven's Ferrets attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
At end of combat, tap all creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets this turn. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Kaysa
cards.text: Green creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Kaysa speaks as the elder druid, but Yavimaya recognizes only one voice: its own.

rulings.text: Kaysa's ability affects itself.

cards.originalText: Green creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Leaping Lizard
cards.text: {1}{G}: Leaping Lizard gets -0/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into lizards. It's her way."
—Devin, faerie noble
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Leaping Lizard gains flying and gets -0/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nature's Wrath
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nature's Wrath unless you pay {G}.
Whenever a player puts an Island or blue permanent onto the battlefield, that player sacrifices an Island or blue permanent.
Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent onto the battlefield, that player sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.

rulings.text: A single permanent may cause both the second and third abilities to trigger. For example, Underground Sea is both an Island and a Swamp, and Skeleton Ship is both blue and black.
Nature's Wrath cares about who puts the permanent onto the battlefield, not under whose control the permanent enters the battlefield under.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nature's Wrath unless you pay {G}.
Whenever a player puts a Swamp or black permanent into play, he or she sacrifices a Swamp or black permanent.
Whenever a player puts an Island or blue permanent into play, he or she sacrifices an Island or blue permanent.

cards.name: Night Soil
cards.text: {1}, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: The elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the thallids did the same.

rulings.text: The two creature cards are exiled as a cost. No one can respond to this. If no graveyard has two creature cards in it, the cost can't be paid.

cards.originalText: {1}, Remove two creature cards in a single graveyard from the game: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Ritual of Subdual
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
cards.flavor:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {C}{C} to that player's mana pool instead.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {2}
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

cards.name: Shrink
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spore Cloud
cards.text: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: Only makes attackers or blockers that have been declared before the spell is cast unable to untap as normal next turn. So, if used before attackers or blockers are declared, it is simply a Fog-like effect. If used after attackers are declared but before blockers are declared, it does the Fog effect and makes attackers not untap as normal. If done after blockers are declared, it has full effect.

If a creature affected by Spore Cloud is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

Spore Cloud doesn't track the creatures' controllers. If an affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Spore Cloud will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Spore Flower
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Spore Flower.
Remove three spore counters from Spore Flower: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Spore Flower.
Remove three spore counters from Spore Flower: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Stunted Growth
cards.text: Target player chooses three cards from their hand and puts them on top of their library in any order.
cards.originalText: Target player chooses three cards from his or her hand and puts them on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Thallid
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Thallid Devourer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Devourer.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid Devourer: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Thallid Devourer gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Devourer.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid Devourer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Thallid Devourer gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Thelonite Druid
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
cards.flavor:
"The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."
—Kolevi of Havenwood, elder druid

rulings.text: The most recent land animating ability takes precedence.
Can sacrifice the Druid to itself.
Only affects Forests that are on the battlefield when the effect resolves.
The land animation ability does not wear off if the land stops being a Forest. It continues until the end of the turn.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

cards.name: Thermokarst
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Tinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R}.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: It deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.
cards.originalText:
Defender
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

cards.name: Whiteout
cards.text:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wiitigo
cards.text:
Wiitigo enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

rulings.text: Any +1/+1 counter from any source can be used with his ability.

cards.originalText:
Wiitigo comes into play with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.name: Wolf Pack
cards.text: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Woolly Mammoths
cards.text: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.originalText:
Reach
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Yavimaya Ancients
cards.text: {G}: Yavimaya Ancients gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We orphans of Fyndhorn have found no welcome in this alien place."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.originalText: {G}: Yavimaya Ancients gets +1/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Diabolic Vision
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Earthlink
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Earthlink unless you pay {2}.
Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Earthlink unless you pay {2}.
Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Elemental Augury
cards.text: {3}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"It is the changing of perception that is important."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
cards.originalText: {3}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Fumarole
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay 3 life.
Destroy target creature and target land.
cards.flavor:
"Too many of us have died in the explosions that wrack these hills."
—Klazina Jansdotter, leader of the Order of the Sacred Torch

rulings.text: Fumarole can't be cast unless you can target both a creature and a land. If there's a permanent on the battlefield that's both a creature and a land, it can be both targets.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Fumarole, pay 3 life.
Destroy target creature and target land.

cards.name: Giant Trap Door Spider
cards.text: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Exile Giant Trap Door Spider and target creature without flying that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

rulings.text: If Giant Trap Door Spider leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the ability will still resolve as normal. The targeted creature will be exiled.
If the targeted creature leaves the battlefield (or otherwise becomes an illegal target) before the ability resolves, the ability won't resolve. Giant Trap Door Spider will remain on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Remove from the game Giant Trap Door Spider and target creature without flying that's attacking you.

cards.name: Nature's Blessing
cards.text: {G}{W}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains banding, first strike, or trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely. Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"Be open to the blessings, whatever their form."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: This ability has no duration. The affected creature will have banding, first strike, or trample until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose its abilities.

cards.originalText: {G}{W}: Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature or that creature gains banding, first strike, or trample.

cards.name: Skeleton Ship
cards.text:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Skeleton Ship.
{T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor:
"The sea gives up her dead as easily as the soil."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Skeleton Ship.
{T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Storm Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Storm Spirit deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian shaman
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Storm Spirit deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Wings of Aesthir
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.
cards.flavor:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.

cards.name: Winter's Night
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a snow land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: If a land affected by Winter's Night is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that land is tapped.

Winter's Night doesn't track the lands' controllers. If an affected land changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Winter's Night will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a snow land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Adarkar Sentinel
cards.text: {1}: Adarkar Sentinel gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We encountered the sentinels in the wastes, near no living thing. Their purpose was inscrutable."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry
cards.originalText: {1}: Adarkar Sentinel gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Aeolipile
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Aeolipile: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Although fragile, the aeolipile could be quite destructive."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Aeolipile: Aeolipile deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ashnod's Cylix
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player looks at the top three cards of their library, puts one of them back on top of their library, then exiles the rest.
cards.flavor: Few remember that Ashnod's defilement of Terisiare's resources outstripped even that of her peers.

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards in their library, look at as many as they have, put one back, and exile the others.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player looks at the top three cards of his or her library, puts one of them back on top of his or her library, then removes the rest from the game.

cards.name: Barbed Sextant
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Clockwork Steed
cards.text:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
When Clockwork Steed's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

If Clockwork Steed has four or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up with a maximum of four such counters on it. If it has four or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Clockwork Steed comes into play with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Despotic Scepter
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target permanent you own. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

rulings.text: You own a nontoken permanent if it started the game in your deck. If it started the game in no one's deck (for example, it was brought into the game by Living Wish), you own it if you brought it into the game.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target permanent you own. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Elkin Bottle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card.

rulings.text: This is not considered to be drawing a card.
If the Bottle leaves the battlefield or your control, the cards remain waiting until played or until the beginning of your next upkeep. The card is in the "Exile" zone.
The card is not part of your hand in any way. You can't be forced to discard it due to a discard from hand effect, and you can't discard it to pay a cost.
To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
If you do not play the card before your next upkeep, it remains exiled; you just lose the ability to play it.

The exiled card is played using the normal timing rules for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions such as "Cast [this card] only during combat." For example, you can't play the card during an opponent's turn unless it's an instant or has flash. Similarly, if the exiled card is a land, you can't play it if you've already played a land that turn. If it's a nonland card, you'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're playing it from the Exile zone.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Remove the top card of your library from the game. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card.

cards.name: Elven Lyre
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Elven Lyre: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the elven lyre that transformed its player.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Elven Lyre: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gustha's Scepter
cards.text:
{T}: Exile a card from your hand face down. You may look at it for as long as it remains exiled.
{T}: Return a card you own exiled with Gustha's Scepter to your hand.
When you lose control of Gustha's Scepter, put all cards exiled with Gustha's Scepter into their owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: The last ability will trigger when a different player gains control of Gustha's Scepter, as well as when Gustha's Scepter leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Remove a card in your hand from the game face down. You may look at it as long as it remains removed from the game.
{T}: Return a card you own removed from the game with Gustha's Scepter to your hand.
When you lose control of Gustha's Scepter, put all cards removed from the game with Gustha's Scepter into their owners' graveyards.

cards.name: Helm of Obedience
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target opponent puts cards from the top of their library into their graveyard until a creature card or X cards are put into that graveyard this way, whichever comes first. If a creature card is put into that graveyard this way, sacrifice Helm of Obedience and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. X can't be 0.

rulings.text: You put the creature card onto the battlefield even if you can't sacrifice Helm of Obedience (because it's left the battlefield by the time its ability resolves, for example).

If an effect like that of Leyline of the Void prevents cards from being put into your opponent's graveyard, the process described in the first sentence of Helm of Obedience's effect will never stop. Your opponent's entire library will be exiled, even if X is 1.

cards.originalText: {1}{X}, {T}: Target opponent puts cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard until a creature card or X cards are put into that graveyard this way, whichever comes first. If a creature card is put into that graveyard this way, sacrifice Helm of Obedience and put that card into play under your control. X can't be 0.

cards.name: Jester's Mask
cards.text:
Jester's Mask enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Mask: Target opponent puts the cards from their hand on top of their library. Search that player's library for that many cards. That player puts those cards into their hand, then shuffles their library.
cards.originalText:
Jester's Mask comes into play tapped.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Mask: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. That player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Jeweled Amulet
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet. Note the type of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Jeweled Amulet.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of Jeweled Amulet's last noted type.

rulings.text: The types of mana are white, blue, black, red, green, and colorless.

Charge counters are indistinguishable from one another. If some other spell or ability (such as Power Conduit's ability) puts a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet, activating Jeweled Amulet's second ability will still check the type of mana last noted by its first ability. If there is no type of mana noted by its first ability (because it hasn't been activated by that point), the second ability will produce no mana.

cards.originalText:
{1}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Jeweled Amulet. Note the type of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Play this ability only if there are no charge counters on Jeweled Amulet.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Jeweled Amulet: Add one mana of Jeweled Amulet's last noted type to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lodestone Bauble
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Put up to four target basic land cards from a player's graveyard on top of their library in any order. That player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: "Up to four" means zero, one, two, three, or four. If you choose zero targets, you still choose a player. That player will draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Lodestone Bauble: Put up to four target basic land cards from a player's graveyard on top of his or her library in any order. That player draws a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Mana Crypt
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}.

rulings.text: No player may choose to take actions between determining the result of the flip and damage being dealt if you lost the flip.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mishra's Groundbreaker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: The very ground yielded to Mishra's wishes.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
The ability's effect has no duration. The affected land will remain an artifact, creature, and land until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect changes its types.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Mishra's Groundbreaker: Target land becomes a 3/3 artifact creature that's still a land.

cards.name: Phyrexian Devourer
cards.text:
When Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.
Exile the top card of your library: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Phyrexian Devourer's first ability continually checks its power as a state trigger. Once it triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again. If the ability resolves, you'll have to sacrifice Phyrexian Devourer even if its power has been reduced to 6 or less by then.

cards.originalText:
When Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.
Remove the top card of your library from the game: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the removed card's converted mana cost. If Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Phyrexian Portal
cards.text: {3}: If your library has ten or more cards in it, target opponent looks at the top ten cards of your library and separates them into two face-down piles. Exile one of those piles. Search the other pile for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle the rest of that pile into your library.

rulings.text: The two piles don't have to have the same number of cards in them. One of the piles may have zero cards.

cards.originalText: {3}: Target opponent looks at the top ten cards of your library and separates them into two face-down piles. Remove one of those piles from the game. Search the other pile for a card and put it into your hand, then shuffle your library. Play this ability only if your library has ten or more cards in it.

cards.name: Roterothopter
cards.text:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor:
"The roterothoper is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, wizard attendant
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Play this ability no more than twice each turn.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.originalText: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Soldevi Simulacrum
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They look human—until they bleed.

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1}
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Time Bomb
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of time counters on Time Bomb.

cards.name: Whirling Catapult
cards.text: {2}, Exile the top two cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.

—General Varchild

cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {R}.)

rulings.text: Land type changing effects that change a dual land's land type will remove the old land types completely. Text-changing effects that just change one of the two land types will leave the other type unaffected.
This card is a Mountain and a Swamp even while in the graveyard, library, or any other zone.
This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

rulings.text: You sacrifice the Mountain before this card is put onto the battlefield, and do so no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.
This card produces two different types of mana. If an effect that adds one mana to your mana pool of the same type as the mana produced by this card, you choose which of the two types it produces.

cards.name: Ice Floe
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

rulings.text: You may target a tapped creature with Ice Floe's activated ability.
The targeted creature is not removed from combat. Its attack will continue as normal.

If the ability resolves, then the creature gains flying later, Ice Floe's effect will not end. (The ability checks whether the creature has flying only at the time you activate it and the time it resolves.)

If the affected creature is untapped by some other spell or ability, Ice Floe's effect will not end. If you keep Ice Floe tapped, and that creature becomes tapped again, Ice Floe will continue to prevent it from being untapped during its controller's untap step.
Ice Floe doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers, Ice Floe will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's untap step.

If Ice Floe untaps or leaves the battlefield, its effect will end. This has no immediate visible affect on the creature. (It doesn't untap immediately, for example.) The creature will just untap as normal during its controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Ice Floe during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target creature without flying that's attacking you. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step as long as Ice Floe remains tapped.

cards.name: Snow-Covered Plains

rulings.text: "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_ set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.
